abstract: Wall Street institutions are of one mind in disliking limitations on their operations, but there is much less unanimity when it comes to the specific rules stemming from Dodd-Frank.
snippet: Wall Street institutions are of one mind in disliking limitations on their operations, but there is much less unanimity when it comes to the specific rules stemming from Dodd-Frank.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: While the biggest rivals on Wall Street share a common disdain for new constraints on financial risk-taking, they're fighting over exactly how to tame the sprawling regulatory overhaul.

headline.main: United in Disdain for Dodd-Frank, Wall Street Is Split on the Details
